title: Pumpkin Pie
requires: Pastry pie dough for a 9-inch pie.
ingredients: 12 ounces Evaporated Milk (2-ounces less of a full can)
instructions: In a small bowl mix the sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves and set aside.

In a large mixing bowl break in the eggs and mix with a wire whisk.  Stir in the sugar and spice mix one tablespoon as a time, mixing well after each addition, until all the sugar and spice mix has been added and blended well with the eggs.  Add the pumpkin next, again one tablespoon at a time, mixing well.  Once the blended mixture is smooth begin adding, gradually, the evaporated milk.  After each addition of evaporated milk blend the mixture well using the whisk.

When all 12-ounces of evaporated milk has been add, and well blended, pour the mixture into an uncooked, 9-inch pie shell.  Gently spin the pie so that the pumpkin mixture is well distributed then cook the pie in a preheated, 425° F. oven for 15 minutes.  After 15 minutes is up reduce the heat of the oven to 350° F. and continue cooking the pie for 40 to 50 minutes; or, until a toothpick, inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack for 2 hours before serving.
remarks: The pie may be stored in the refrigerator, covered with plastic wrap, but don’t freeze as the pumpkin filling will separate from the pie crust. Serve with a dollop of whipping cream; or for a difference, try serving with Harrod’s “Hard Sauce”.  For the “Hard Sauce” see the recipe in the “Sauces, Stock, and Dressings” folder. Source:  Libby’s Pumpkin Can Label, from a 15-ounce can of 100% pure pumpkin.
